metadata.name: Reflejos #70
metadata.description:
Reflejos es un proyecto de arte generativo dise√±ado para existir en la blockchain de Tezos. Este proyecto se aloja en la plataforma fx(hash) y genera obras de arte √∫nicas utilizando un algoritmo y un sistema num√©rico hexadecimal que se crea con cada nuevo token.

Este proyecto fue desarrollado utilizando la librer√≠a p5.js de JavaScript, creada por Lauren Lee McCarthy. Reflejos es el resultado de la interacci√≥n entre la percepci√≥n humana y un conjunto de reglas interpretadas por la m√°quina.

Inspirado por la experiencia de caminar junto al mar y los estados de calma y contemplaci√≥n que esta actividad puede evocar, Reflejos busca entrelazar a los espectadores con las obras de la colecci√≥n. 

La intenci√≥n es motivar al espectador a explorar su interior y descubrir momentos de apertura perceptiva. 

El objetivo es que la obra provoque una sensaci√≥n de calma y claridad en el espectador a trav√©s de una conexi√≥n √≠ntima y personal.

metadata.name: Slumbers #17
metadata.description:
Generative abstract artwork that explores forms, shapes, coloring and brushwork.

Options:

- press 'f' to turn off paper-like texture (recommended for print on hi-quality paper)
- press 's' to save the PNG image of the current view
- press 1, 2, 3, or 4 to save hi-res PNG images

Colors and textures might differ slightly on some devices due to the heavy use of low alpha blending. Calibrated and tested on Firefox 107.0 & Chrome 107.0.5304.107 on Win10 x64 Intel machine.

Created using p5js.

@VolatileMoods, November, 2022.
tags: slumbers volatile moods abstract generative painting colors brushwork

metadata.name: Millefoglie #49
metadata.description:
"A mille-feuille (French pronunciation: ‚Äã[mil f≈ìj], "thousand-sheets"), also known by the names Napoleon, vanilla slice, and custard slice, is a dessert made of puff pastry layered with pastry cream. Its modern form was influenced by improvements made by Marie-Antoine Car√™me.

Traditionally, a mille-feuille is made up of three layers of puff pastry (p√¢te feuillet√©e), alternating with two layers of pastry cream (cr√®me p√¢tissi√®re). The top pastry layer is finished in various ways: sometimes it is topped with whipped cream, or it may be dusted with icing sugar, cocoa, pastry crumbs, or sliced almonds. It may also be glazed with icing or fondant alone, or in alternating white (icing) and brown (chocolate) or other colored icing stripes, and combed to create a marbled effect." ‚Äî Wikipedia

Prints available upon request: prints@stefancontiero.com
Best enjoyed on browsers supporting Display-P3 color gamut.

License: CC BY-NC-ND 4.0

@stefan_contiero

metadata.name: hollow #192
metadata.description:
In 1993, Basque sculptor Eduardo Chillida proposed a project to create an immense void inside Tindaya, the Sacred Mountain of Fuerteventura's indigenous inhabitants. The hollow cube measuring approximately 45 x 50 x 65 meters was conceived as a space for "all the people" to "fully experience the tininess of humankind".

The idea of the project dates back to the 1980s, and it took the artist years of searching for the ideal mountain in different parts of the world. However, what was ideal for Chillida evoked a lot of controversy due to the environmental and social impact of the project. There was uncertainty about Tindaya's structural feasibility and the potential harm to the ancient petroglyphs engraved on its surface. What's more, the financial sustainability of the project's economic model would depend on hundreds of thousands of tourists visiting the site each year, converting a work of art into a holiday attraction.

Chillida called his project the Monument to Tolerance. Although it never came into existence, it has caused division and conflict since it was conceived.


"hollow" is an exploration of 256 voids in nonexistent natural monuments. Made of digital matter instead of stone and lacking cultural charge, its sole purpose is to contemplate the tininess of humankind.


-----

Click on the image to open the menu. You may choose the quality from preview to the resolution of a print of approximately 30cm in height. In live mode, click on PNG to save the rendered image.

Depending on the device and CPU usage, it takes from a few seconds (on fast computers) to a minute (sometimes more) on mid-tier phones to render the image. 

Requirements: 1GB of RAM. The system needs up to 200 MB of free RAM for rendering square preview images and up to 400 MB of free RAM for rendering square images at the highest resolution. I tested on Chrome, Safari, Firefox, Edge / Windows, Mac OS, Android, and iPhone, but please make sure it works on your device before minting.

-----

Possible features:

color scheme: cairngorm, alborz, bardenas, atlas, bieszczady, watkins

proportions: square, wide, standard, narrow

frame: none, vignette, bright, dark, bright with vignette, dark with vignette

visitors: tourists, tourists and birds, solitary flock of birds, only light

A grid of many lines forming a dragon crafted on paper.

tw: williamapan

metadata.name: contrapuntos #90
metadata.description:
Musical counterpoint is to me an abstraction of the layered, intertwining rhythms of every activity we carry on in our lives. With a global tempo typically set in days, we fit all sorts of temporal structures where our joys and fears live and play out over the span of our lives. This series is a metaphorical transposition of the musical counterpoint into a visual space, sometimes with repeating patterns, sometimes with broken structures, sometimes isolated notes / hours / souls.

Artwork by Marcelo Soria-Rodr√≠guez, @msoriaro. Made with p5js & glsl.

metadata.name: Geode #109
metadata.description:
A single seed shape is chosen from 13, and placed onto the plane. At every step, a copy of this seed is laid edge-to-edge adjacent to an existing shape, without causing any overlaps. This copy is colored based on the edge it shares with the existing shape. The process continues until the animation completes.

New shapes are placed closest to a moving target. In some mints, this target is slow moving, causing new shapes to expand radially from the seed. In other mints, this target races around, causing new shapes to chase it. 

Each of the 13 shapes forms different patterns under different circumstances. Not all patterns will be explored.

Controls:
  - SPACE: Pause/unpause the animation.
  - ENTER: Skip the animation.
  - R: Restart the animation.

URL Params:
  - "preview=1": Skip the animation.
  - "flex=1": Adapt the boundaries to the size of the window.
  - ‚Äúslow=1‚Äù: Draw only one shape per frame.

Licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

metadata.name: Bardez #292
metadata.description:
Bardez is the Armenian word for garden. It is etymologically tied to an ancient word for paradise, but that link goes deeper than etymology. Gardens have always been small pieces of paradise for me, and hearing the word in Armenian triggers a flood of warm memories.

Memories of wandering around my grandfather‚Äôs garden, plucking ripe plums and figs from their branches.
Memories of playing in my parents yard, the scent of jasmine in the summer heat.
Of sun warmed tomatoes in my mom‚Äôs vegetable patch.
The smell of dirt and grass.
Mud on my hands.
Sun on my skin.
Memories of paradise.

I hope you enjoy these gardens I‚Äôve planted, and I hope they remind you of some warm and wonderful memories.
 
Nat Sarkissian






Notes:
 - This piece uses a shader to compute the lighting of the terrain in the first frame. If you don‚Äôt have a graphics card, you may have difficulty running this.

 - Append ‚Äú&mag=N‚Äù to the end of the URL in live mode to specify a resolution multiplier. It will render the image N times larger than the size of your window. If you have specified anything greater than 1, a download will start automatically once the rendering is done. The maximum resolution seems to be limited by what your web browser allows. I have been able to output up to 11140px tall and wide using Firefox, which should be enough detail for prints up to 37x37 inches. I recommend keeping the console open while attempting larger renders. It will show you the progress of the render, and also show you if you have attempted too large a render for your system. N can be any positive whole or decimal number greater than or equal to 1.

 - Finally, collectors at the highest tier will be entitled to a signed print of their edition. For further details and updates, keep an eye on my Twitter (@_NatSarkissian).

metadata.name: Crosswalk Monsoon #174
metadata.description:
The story behind this collection is that there isn't really a story behind this collection. It is the result of play, tinkering, and curiosity.

One of the beautiful things about generative art is how we can achieve drastically different results simply by modifying a few parameters or lines of code. As my first release here on fxhash was 'Sabler', it felt fitting that my release for #fxhashturnsone would itself be a modified version of that 'Sabler' algorithm, albeit giving drastically different results.

It is notable for the fact that this is perhaps my most 'chaotic' collection yet, letting go of carefully considered proportions, angles and positioning and here leaving that in the hands of the computer. In a way, this simple act represents several design decisions I never would have imagined myself making a year ago, highlighting my growth as a generative artist over the past year.

It is also a reflection of the inspiration gained from many of the artists and boundary-pushers in the space that each time unlock and encourage creations beyond the immediate comfort zone. For that, this is a 'Thank You' to all of you.

With that, here's to many more years of generative beauty and inspiration on fxhash and beyond.

As with previous collections, I highly recommend viewing the images at full size and savouring the details and the chaos up close. Pressing 'S' will save a 6000 x 6000 px PNG file.

50% of primary sales will be donated to the Processing Foundation.

metadata.name: Pinwheel #219
metadata.description:
A pinwheel.

Created as part of the anniversary mint event #fxhashturnsone.

In fullscreen mode: double click, double tap or press 's' to save a still at the current resolution.

metadata.name: 365 Tentacles #252
metadata.description:
Wow, Fxhash ! What a year !

For #fxhashturnsone I decided to explore how far I could take a simple concept: drawing 365 tentacles.
This turned out to be an interesting exercise, as having a strict limitation seemed to spark more ideas than when having complete freedom. There's a lot you can do with 365 things !

99.9% of primary sales go to the Processing Foundation.

Key commands:
's' to save a png image
'1', '2', '4' to change resolution
'+', '-' to change rendering zoom

metadata.name: fx(haish) / the Generator #329
metadata.description:
fx(haish) is my contribution to #fxhashturnsone
fx(haish) is not a finished product
fx(haish) is a co-creation experiment
fx(haish) is a fun exploration of a mixed GenAI process

fx(haish) is my Happy Birthday to fx(hash). 

Have fun, collectors!


// HOW TO PARTICIPATE

Step 1. Mint or collect ‚Äúfx(haish) - the Generator‚Äù
Step 2. Visit https://www.arqtistic.com/fx(haish) to generate your ‚Äúfx(haish) - The AI City‚Äù based on your mint. You have 20 tries.
Step 3. Await further instructions.


// FURTHER INFO

This algorithm has been designed to produce images which are suitable for the subsequent AI generation. The token consists of a random number of randomly placed and sized rectangles, filled with a noise gradient pattern. In short, Diffusion AI Models thrive on noise.

The AI generation uses Stable Diffusion 1.5 through an API designed by the 330ai team (@Pixelmindai). The WebUI has been developed by Nik0gda (@AntonCebanu2). AI Prompt has been designed (by me) to produce images of Cities, but you can possibly make it do other things, if you try hard enough.

metadata.name: Asterium #155
metadata.description:
Asterium is a token that will grow with you, for an entire year. Changing and morphing over time to eventually reach its equilibrium.

It is a token where I try to symbolize the journey of life.
Where looking back is the best way to look forward.
Where looking into the future is not a possibility.
Where each day is as uncertain as the next.

A token that will surprise you and have its ups and downs as it grows over time.



Pricing:
Dutch auction 64-16-8, where anybody that picks one up at 64 tez gets a print of how their galaxy looks on any day from the present to day 0. Meaning you can claim the print at any point in the future.

The print will be printed on high quality hahnem√ºhle torchon paper at 30x40 cm (11.81 x 15.75 in). Printed at a local print shop here in Utrecht. This paper has a rough texture to it that matches the textures of space perfectly.



Usage:
- Hover over your Asterium to view the name, date, days passed, status and render stats.
- Double press to export the current frame as a .png image.
- Use the slider at the bottom to scroll back in time to the days before today, you can go as far back as day 0 and as far forwards as today.
- The token refreshes every hour, so framing it in a digital picture frame is totally possible!

metadata.name: Harmonies #307
metadata.description:
Harmonies is a color palette generator created for fxhash anniversary. The generator chooses from 7 possible color harmonies "Complementary, Split-Complementary, Analogous, Triadic, Tetradic, Square, Analogous and Monochromatic" to create harmonic color palettes. When i studied colors back in time, i used to take a color or a couple of colors and paint strokes on paper with watercolors to understand and learn how they stand out together. This piece is a result of those studies.

5 stroke compositions for 'Split-Complementary, Analogous and Triadic'
3 stroke compositions for 'Tetradic, Square and Monochromatic'
3 stroke compositions for 'Complementary'
2 color mods "Saturated and Muted' and 6 rendering methods for strokes 'Random Saturated, Random Brightness, Random Brightness & Saturation, Saturation Gradient, Brightness Gradient, Brightness & Saturation Gradient'

Save image by pressing 's'
Save colors as hex array ready to be used by pressing 'p'

Created with p5.js | Murat Atimtay 2022

objkt.name: Ode to Bugs and Happy Accidents #216

metadata.name: Ode to Bugs and Happy Accidents #216
metadata.description:
‚ÄúIf debugging is the process of removing software bugs, then programming must be the process of putting them in.‚Äù

‚Äï¬†Edsger W. Dijkstra


This artwork is dedicated to happy accidents, mistakes, and bugs. Every key part of it is based on some sort of failure: wrong variable value, unstopped recursion, untimely function call. And sometimes it leads to pleasant results.

It was created to celebrate #fxhashturnsone event.

The earnings are partly donated to:
- Processing Foundation
- #TezosStandsWithUkraine

[a] - toggle animation
[1] - save PNG in low resolution
[2] - save PNG in medium resolution
[3] - save PNG in high resolution
[4] - save PNG in ultra-high resolution

Saving with high and ultra-high resolution may take a while, please be patient.


Made with love and p5js

By Collapsar Beauty
CC BY-NC-ND 4.0
